wikipedia_page.main: Emma Handy (born 24 March 1974) is a British actress best known for her West End stage work and her role as DC Paula McIntyre in the ITV1 award-winning drama series Wire in the Blood in which she appeared for five series.

response: * Emma Handy as DC Paula McIntyre (Series 2–6)

* D.C. Paula McIntyre (Emma Handy) is a lively and feisty young detective. She is not fazed easily and is keen to take on more responsibility and pleased to have strong role models in Carol and later, Alex. She also has a deep respect for Tony after he saved her life while on the job.

* D.S. Annie Reiss (Doreene Blackstock) (Series 1) is an Afro-British detective who is part of Jordan's team. Reiss only appears in the first series, after which she is replaced by Paula McIntyre (Emma Handy) (Series 2–6).

response: * Susie Blake and Emma Handy in Handbagged (2015)

link_mentions.page: List of The Story of Tracy Beaker (franchise) characters

response: The play toured the UK from September to December 2015 starring Susie Blake and Kate Fahy, with the younger queen portrayed by Emma Handy. It visited Canterbury, Salford, Guildford, Oxford, Coventry, Cambridge, Nottingham, Newcastle-upon-Tyne, Edinburgh, Norwich, Cheltenham,"The arts diary: Handbagged, Everyman Theatre, Cheltenham" . Gloucestershire Echo November 17, 2015 Richmond, Cambridge and Bath."Handbagged review: Susie Blake and Emma Handy star in the comedy at the Theatre Royal". ChronicleLive Oct 27, 2015"Handbagged review at Theatre Royal, Bath" . Bath Chronicle, December 01,
